text.2064:
(3/4) Once it falls, black carbon darkens the surface of ice and snow, where it absorbs energy from sunlight. That causes melting on the surface while also reducing how well ice reflects solar radiation back into space.

#climatechange #blackcarbon #arctic #icemelt #science
text.2065:
(2/4) Black carbon stays aloft for only a few days to weeks before falling. While airborne, it is a short-lived climate pollutant that is many times more potent than carbon dioxide at warming the atmosphere, though it has a far shorter lifespan. 

#climatechange #blackcarbon
